snippet: The United States is in the grip of an early start to the annual flu season with an unusually aggressive virus, a new type of norovirus, and the worst outbreak of whooping cough in decades.
abstract: United States is in the grip of early start to the annual flu season with unusually aggressive virus, that is already widespread across nation; complicating health concerns are new type of norovirus, and worst outbreak of whooping cough in decades.

byline.original: By DONALD G. McNEIL Jr. and KATHARINE Q. SEELYE

lead_paragraph: The United States is in the grip of an early start to the annual flu season with an unusually aggressive virus, a new type of norovirus, and the worst outbreak of whooping cough in decades.

headline.seo: Flu Widespread, Leading a Range of Winter’s Ills
headline.main: Flu Widespread, Leading a Range of Winter’s Ills
headline.print_headline: Flu Widespread, Leading a Range of Winter’s Ills
